Hi,
Is it possible to have BOTH Junit 3.x and 4.0 coexist in eclipse and use
@Test , and also the conventional Junit test cases? If this is possible,
then what exactly do I need to do in eclipse in order to achieve this?
Thanks,
-Kamal.
subject: JUnit 3.x and JUnit 4.0 in Eclipse
